COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS; STATE OF CALIFORNIA; STATE OF MARYLAND; STATE OF WASHINGTON; STATE OF ARIZONA; STATE OF COLORADO; STATE OF DELAWARE; STATE OF HAWAI'I; STATE OF MINNESOTA; STATE OF NEVADA; STATE OF NEW JERSEY; STATE OF NEW MEXICO; STATE OF NEW YORK; STATE OF OREGON; STATE OF RHODE ISLAND; and STATE OF WISCONSIN,

extracted.value: Commonwealth of Massachusetts, State of California, State of Maryland, State of Washington, State of Arizona, State of Colorado, State of Delaware, State of Hawai'i, State of Minnesota, State of Nevada, State of New Jersey, State of New Mexico, State of New York, State of Oregon, State of Rhode Island, and State of Wisconsin appealed to the United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit.

evidence.text: Judge Brian E. Murphy: ELECTRONIC ORDER GRANTING 58 Assented to MOTION to Set a Briefing Schedule on Plaintiffs' Motion for a Preliminary Injunction and NOTICE of Withdrawal of Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order. The 8 Emergency Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order is WITHDRAWN. Briefing schedule for the Motion for Preliminary Injunction is ADOPTED and hearing is set.BRIEFING SCHEDULE:Plaintiffs' Motion for Preliminary Injunction shall be filed 4/14/2025.Oppositions to Motion for Preliminary Injunction shall be filed by 4/30/2025.Replies shall be filed by 5/5/2025.NOTICE OF HEARING:Hearing on Motion for Preliminary Injunction is scheduled for 5/9/2025 at 1:30 p.m. in Courtroom 12 (In person only) before Judge Brian E. Murphy. (BIB) (Entered: 04/09/2025)

extracted.value: On April 9, 2025, the court granted the Motion to Set a Briefing Schedule for the Motion for Preliminary Injunction, withdrew the Emergency Motion for Temporary Restraining Order, and scheduled a hearing for May 9, 2025.

evidence.text: Emergency MOTION for Temporary Restraining Order by State of Nevada, State of New Jersey, State of New York, State of Oregon, State of Rhode Island, State of Wisconsin, Commonwealth of Massachusetts, State of California, State of Maryland, State of Washington, State of Arizona, State of Delaware, State of Hawaii. (Attachments: # 1 Text of Proposed Order)(Cedrone, Gerard) (Entered: 04/04/2025)

extracted.value: State of Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Oregon, Rhode Island, Wisconsin, Massachusetts, California, Maryland, Washington, Arizona, Delaware, and Hawaii filed an Emergency Motion for Temporary Restraining Order on April 4, 2025, seeking immediate relief to halt certain federal directives.

evidence.text: AMENDED COMPLAINT for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief against All Defendants, filed by State of Nevada, State of New Jersey, State of New Mexico, State of New York, State of Oregon, State of Rhode Island, State of Wisconsin, Commonwealth of Massachusetts, State of California, State of Maryland, State of Washington, State of Arizona, State of Colorado, State of Delaware, State of Hawaii, State of Minnesota. extracted.value: State of Nevada, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, Oregon, Rhode Island, Wisconsin, Massachusetts, California, Maryland, Washington, Arizona, Colorado, Delaware, Hawaii, and Minnesota filed an Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief on April 14, 2025, updating the initial complaint with additional exhibits and legal arguments.

extracted.value: State of Nevada, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, Oregon, Rhode Island, Wisconsin, Massachusetts, California, Maryland, Washington, Arizona, Delaware, Hawaii, and Minnesota filed a Motion for Preliminary Injunction on April 14, 2025, seeking a court order to halt certain federal actions pending final resolution of the case.

evidence.text: the district court held a trial on the merits, ruled in the plaintiffs' favor, including on their arbitrary and capricious claims, and entered two orders setting aside the new policy and related grant terminations as 'illegal' under the APA.

extracted.value: The district court held a trial on the merits, ruling in the plaintiffs' favor on their arbitrary and capricious claims, and entered two orders setting aside the new policy and related grant terminations as 'illegal' under the APA.
